text: hi everyone Anthony fantano here the
internet's most unshaven music nerd and
it's time for an album review the men
leave home these guys are a New York
band this is their second full-length LP
I heard a lot of people asking me to
review this back in May when it came out
I promised myself I would get to it
eventually so here I am now if you're a
punk fan if you're a hardcore punk fan a
noise Rock fan if you've enjoyed albums
like ice age's new brigade that came out
this year I think this is definitely
something you need to try out these guys
have a lot of good things going for them
they recorded this LP to tape so the
Distortion the really saturated and and
compressed guitars are just really
filthy they're grimy the the Distortion
is is is really coarse it's the
difference between you know rubbing some
sandpaper on your hand and having your
skull just like dragged across 100 yards
of asphalt the drums are booming the
guitars are just abrasive they're loud
out there but what I think is really
cool outside of the production is that
there are three people in this band who
all kind of share songwriting duties so
this LP has a kind of
schizophrenic makeup with one song going
in a completely different direction than
the next the opening track does a heavy
psychedelic kind of thing the third
track goes into this noise Punk thing
with these dissonant interludes where
these guitars all freak out and play
these random leads the last track has
the kind of driving Post Punk repetition
that that bands like the fall
popularized the sixth track sounds
exactly like a fugazi song and the
fourth is almost kind of like a doom
metal track so there's a lot of
variation among these tracks almost to
the point where this album is is kind of
scatterbrained the only thing that to me
really links all these songs together is
that no matter what different idea the
men seem to be chasing after they just
turn it all the way up to 11 and just do
it in the most extreme way they possibly
can in terms of volume in terms of noise
in terms of speed in terms of energy so
this has kind of led to an LP that has
an interesting progression it's always
Switching gears and there's nothing more
I hate than putting on an album the
first few tracks are are hard they're
heavy they're loud they're maybe they're
fast too they're extreme and it's got me
pumped and maybe like three or four
tracks and I just start getting bored
because all the songs sound the same not
the problem here but I do have a major
issue with this LP it's kind of a major
issue while I don't really hate any of
the songs here the guitar riffs The
Melodies a lot of them are just so Bland
and forgettable and just kind of like
throw away for me you know I I know
nothing is 100 original these days
everybody is borrowing from somewhere
but I just don't really find anything
distinct about the guitar riffs that are
used on a lot of these tracks They Don't
Really stick into my head and most of
the time they're just kind of giving me
this this sense of Deja Vu I think it's
something that should be checked out if
you are into noise Rock if you are into
punk rock and post punk I'm feeling
addition six on this but what did you
think about it if you've heard it do you
love it do you hate it
why and what do you think I should
review next
Anthony fantano thank you for watching
the men forever
